page.title: 18LOCHARDIL & HOLM
page.content: We decided to do a survey of about 70 houses in the neighbourhood to find out what kind of people lived there and what they would most like to see being improved. About half of the houses had no one in. The rest were evenly divided between people who had young children and those whose families were grown up. The people with grown up families were quite happy and did not want many changes. The others with younger children suggested more shops to include a chemist, better playing areas for young children and a football ground for older boys and girls. A church was also mentioned by two people. Most people were, on the whole, pleased to live in these lovely estates.
